summary: Fail to open a downloaded PDF file on Ubuntu

changes.removed: Fail to Open a downloaded PDF file
changes.added: Fail to open a downloaded PDF file on Ubuntu

comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:56.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/56.0
Build ID: 20170720100139

Steps to reproduce:

Go to http://www.pdf995.com/samples/pdf.pdf
Click on Download
Choose Open "Document viewer (default)" (Evince in my case

Firefox 56.0a1 (2017-07-20) (64-bit)
With firefox 54 from Ubuntu, no issue


Actual results:

Evince is launched but fails to open file with 
Unable to open document "file:///tmp/mozila_USER/pdf.pdf"
Failed to load backend for 'application/pdf': libnss3.so: failed to map segment from shared object.

(but I can still open a document from menu)

Same issue when Saving file on disk then opening it from Download Library.

I can't reproduce issue with other kind of file (tried with VLC, Image viewer)


Expected results:

Evince is running properly
comments.author: murlock42@gmail.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Michael Bonfils from comment #0)
> Failed to load backend for 'application/pdf': libnss3.so: failed to map
> segment from shared object.

This looks like an error specific to the distribution. It should probably be reported to the distribution, but I'll leave this bug open in case there is anything we can do on the Firefox side.
comments.author: paolo.mozmail@amadzone.org

comments.text:
It's likely to be a problem with the apparmor profile that ships with Ubuntu. It's set to protect Firefox as installed by Ubuntu, but not a version of Firefox installed in a different place.

To confirm that apparmor is at fault, run "dmesg" as root and look for messages like these:

[143328.203088] audit: type=1400 audit(1501788170.947:64): apparmor="DENIED" operation="file_mmap" profile="/usr/bin/evince" name="/home/francois/devel/nightly/libnss3.so" pid=17713 comm="EvJobScheduler" requested_mask="m" denied_mask="m" fsuid=1000 ouid=1000
[143328.203807] audit: type=1400 audit(1501788170.947:65): apparmor="DENIED" operation="file_mmap" profile="/usr/bin/evince" name="/home/francois/devel/nightly/libnss3.so" pid=17713 comm="EvJobScheduler" requested_mask="m" denied_mask="m" fsuid=1000 ouid=1000

If you have something similar, then you can follow these instructions to tweak the apparmor profile and whitelist your manually-installed version of Firefox:

https://askubuntu.com/questions/486150/evince-error-while-loading-shared-libraries-permission-denied/486158#486158

I ran into this problem with Nightly and I solved it by running "aa-logprof" a few times and accepting the proposed changes from that tool. It's pretty straightforward but the annoying thing is that you have to whitelist libraries one at a time and restart evince in between attempts. After 5-10 times, everything that's needed should be covered though.
comments.author: francois@fmarier.org

comments.text:
I confirm that I have apparmor logs in dmesg 

[332644.807731] audit: type=1400 audit(1501831728.078:42): apparmor="DENIED" operation="file_mmap" profile="/usr/bin/evince" name="/home/murlock/apps/firefox/libnss3.so" pid=6352 comm="EvJobScheduler" requested_mask="m" denied_mask="m" fsuid=1000 ouid=1000
[332644.808747] audit: type=1400 audit(1501831728.078:43): apparmor="DENIED" operation="file_mmap" profile="/usr/bin/evince" name="/home/murlock/apps/firefox/libnss3.so" pid=6352 comm="EvJobScheduler" requested_mask="m" denied_mask="m" fsuid=1000 ouid=1000


Thanks !

Not sure why evince try to use nss3 of firefox, is there any LD_lIBRARY_PATH set by Nightly or because working dir is left to firefox directory when starting external executable ?
comments.author: murlock42@gmail.com
